title: Good luck getting an appointment
body: There used to be a great online booking service to get to see a doctor, you might have to wait 3 weeks but that was OK. Now you are restricted to phoning the surgery in the morning when they open to get an appointment, trouble is there are a lot of people doing exactly the same so by the time you get to speak to someone you are told there are no appointments left, call back the next day. Sadly this practise gives the impression its open purely for the convenience of the staff employed there.

title: Phone & emails not answered, prescription not…
body: I’ve just joined this surgery but I wish I hadn’t. The phone is never answered, emails are not replied to, and my repeat prescription has not been fulfilled meaning I’m nearly out of medication. Very poor indeed.

title: Fantastic team at Penshurst Gardens!
body:
The care my family and I have received from our Doctor and his team is more than I could have ever hoped for. From my initial reach out for much needed help a couple of months ago,  my doctor's follow up with guidance and support has exceeded my expectations. I have not had to come to the surgery for a while but in my recent visit I have seen a great improvement in the culture of the surgery, where there is clearly a super team of doctors and support staff. My family and I are very grateful for the heartfelt care provided by our Doctor for my mother through her years of dementia and the support we have all received with her transition to a nursing home.
Thank you in particular to my Doctor , he put me in touch with so many members of his team - a really helpful Health Coach to assist me with my diet, fitness and general well being, the Nurse on site to check my bloods, a Physiotherapist who consulted me on an injury I have suffered with for a year now, the reception staff who are being very helpful with me getting a referral appointment and a counsellor to assess my mental health. I am so grateful for the time and attention the Doctor and his entire team have offered me, all within the surgery and via telephone consultations, without me having to visit the hospital. This is a great team who are clearly not just going through the motions, there is genuine concern and duty of care, which is so appreciated. 
I would recommend Penshurst Gardens Surgery to anyone I know.

title: Kind and understanding practice
body: Suffering from severe mental health issues and women's health problems at the same time, I went to my GP at Newton Medical Centre for help. She was incredibly kind, understanding and empathetic about my medical condition, which I'd been deeply ashamed of and shunned out of a hospital for. She sent me home with a test right away and transparently explained the timeline and how soon I will get results and medication. Her care has completely restored my faith in the NHS.

title: Doctors excellent one of receptionist unhelpful
body:
I required a referral  letter, that had been sent to consultants office at the Nuffield, to be  sent again as I had been left a message by his secretary to say they had not received it. My appointment was for the following week. 
I felt by the way I was spoken to by the receptionist that I was being difficult and asking for something that couldn’t be done. 
She was quite stroppy and seemed very reluctant to help. She queried  how I could have an appointment if the consultant hadn’t had the referral. 
To be honest it wasn’t so much what she said it was the way she said it. She comes across as irritated and unhelpful . 
I usually have found the receptionists at the practice really friendly and helpful .  
I know they are all under enormous pressure at the moment and it is difficult being on the front line however I now reluctant to call the surgery as I feel like I am being a nuisance.

title: Shocking !!!
body: 26 week pregnant been referred by doctor to attend immediately. Was left to sit in waiting room 8 and half hours before going home due to toilets been an absolute disgrace no where to get food and not one person saw doctor in 2 hours. Was told they was only 2 doctors in whole hospital to treat emergencies, adult and children.

title: Excellent and well managed practised
body:
I have developed a horrible condition were 60% of my hair has fallen out and has become scarring. 

The Mwh practised refer me to the right subspecialty, prescribe the medications recommended, organised blood tests, and helped me with anxiety and occupational issues.

During this time my baby daughter recieved all her newborn vaccines and checks.

They have a good telephone triaging and can get a face to face or telephone appointment with the doctor or nurse.

My time in the area is only temporary but I feel the service is excellent and comparable to mine Gp practise in another country within the Uk.

title: Wonderful ward 14.
body: Fantastic care, all staff very friendly and helpful, couldn't have received better care anywhere, just amazing all of them.

title: Excellent care let down by it's systems
body: I was taken by ambulance to A&E with breathing problems and a nasty cough. I cannot speak highly enough about the care, efficiency and professionalism of the staff. I was x-rayed, fitted with a cannula, had bloods taken and delivered safely to EMU in just under 4 hours all with a smile, excellent.  I spent a night and day on the equally well run EMU and cannot speak highly enough of their care, especially how they seem to group patients with similar problems together.  My room mates and I coughed wheezed and spent 2 sleepless nights together in tolerance and harmony.  My shock therefore when i was moved to the so called respiratory ward Pearson was immense. The first bay contained exhausted looking patients forced to spend the entirety of their stay with a person who was shrieking the same name over and over at full volume and had been doing so for a week i was told.  The noise was intolerable and loud noises being one of my triggers, I confess to a meltdown and insisted i was going home.  The staff of this ward were amazing, and somehow managed to find me a bed in a quieter bay.  Their care for this anxiety panic attack sufferer was exemplary.  My respect for them grew as I watched them deal all night with the geriatric patient in my bay who's respiratory system seemed in fine order judging by the noise and abuse they inflicted on those caring for them.  I was told the geriatic wards were full and the patient was such a problem they'd been with them for several weeks.  During the rest of the night as I was cursed and insulted by other people in my bay every time i coughed or wheezed it became apparent that Pearson ward seems to be used as a dumping ground for patients not wanted by social services and other wards.  I was the only person coughing and wheezing in my bay and was shouted at and accused of having a nasty disease.  Seemed odd behaviour for supposed fellow respiratory patients.  The member of staff posted on a chair in the doorway to keep guard was another clue!  The staff and patients of this ward deserve better.  They couldn't even find a nebuliser machine for me...in a respiratory ward..really?  The computer system was refusing to accept the passwords allocated to agency staff, making them toothless and unable to log in. My eternal thanks to the staff member who supplied me with earplugs and mask so I could ignore the hurtful comments and all the staff who did their utmost to comfort me in the worst night I have ever had in hospital.  I hope your employers treat you better in the future.  Calow, Pearson ward is a disgrace, your staff and patients deserve better.

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Was an excellent practice, but service has…
body: I joined Queen Square several years ago after moving to Lancaster and always found it to be excellent, however, more recently I have found it impossible to get an appointment. As a disabled person with a long-term health condition, this is especially problematic. In addition, I found out recently that my named GP, who I had a good relationship with and who was very familiar with my medical history, had left the practice, however, I was not informed of this by Queen Square. This information was confirmed during a phone conversation when I called to check after reading something online. Only then was I told who my new named GP would be and this was someone I had never seen previously. As a result of my recent experiences with the practice, I have moved to another local practice with a better CQC rating. I hope Queen Square work out their appointment booking process and communication with patients, as I believe the remaining medical staff there are very good and they are being let down by both, as are their patients.

title: Very Helpful Doctor
body:
I visited the Doctor as I was worried about a symptom.
After talking it over with her, and Doctor examining me, my mind was put to rest that everything was ok.
The Doctor was very nice with a charming manner.
Thank you!

author: Simply01
title: The nurses were wonderful, kind and informative
body: I went for oedema treatment at the Manor Park clinic. Rita and Natasha, the nurses have been wonderful, kind and informative as they treated me and dressed my legs. I am deeply grateful for their professionalism and understanding.

title: Great service.
body:
Just thought I’d leave a positive review for Holmewood surgery. Recently had blood tests at Basingstoke hospital. Doctor rang within 2 days with results and what needs to be done. A few days  later rang again to check all was well and with more information after researching questions I had asked on the 1st call. 
After so many negative comments about the surgery I just thought I would just say I felt well looked after and the Doctor involved was very helpful and professional. Thank you.

title: Great Practice
body: Both my wife and I, who visit this surgery fairly regularly, have always found the service provided excellent. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. We do find the opportunity to have a telephone consultation an additional bonus as sometimes this works for both parties just as well. Plus able to have a "face to face", if required. So Many Thanks to you all and our best wishes.

title: Lacking
body: The receptionists have always been courteous and helpful but the service to patients since the three surgeries joined together has fallen through the floor. What has gone wrong? This is a long standing issue and the newsletters will promote all the things they are doing e.g. a walking group, but there doesn’t seem to be a truly compassionate understanding of the issues which include holding in telephone queues with the constant, unpleasant reminders to hang up if you are not very ill,  switching off E-consult and a scarcity of routine appointments. These issues make it very stressful for patients to deal with the practice. For the most part, the individual staff are great but the three-surgery hub model doesn’t appear to be working, at least from a patient perspective. I wonder how they continue to get away with it - surely there is only so long they can say ‘we’re doing our best to improve’…this has been going on for years.

title: Efficient
body: I went to see the Dr on Monday 24th July at 1000 and within 15 minutes I was on my way to the JR, the response to my problem was excellent. I was kept in at the JR with the Dr saying it could have been a very different story if I had left it any later. So very grateful for such quick and efficient care

author: butterbean
title: Carlisle Mental health
body: I am a patient on the Carlisle Mental health ward at Rampton. There are seclusions happening and we cannot do stuff. staff get moved around sometimes to other wards . please listen to me and keep staff on our ward as things get cancelled for us other patients stop ticking the boxes tick box exercise.

title: Major operation
body: If you can feel reassured in a strange environment Christie’s is the place . Quality care in this day and age is priceless. Attentive nurses and doctors throughout my procedure . And you still feel human , cared for and listened to . Fantastic team carry on being top quality.

title: I have used the park hospital for over 30 years…
body: I am a self paying patient. The hospital and staff are still great can not fault them     I saw a consultant who told me I was to have the nerves in my hand checked I did and was ask there and then for payment in cash not card  so we at to drive to cash machine to get the money out  and take it back to him ,  I have recently had a small operation on my wrist I told to be in the hospital for 7 in morning. On arrival I was taken to  my room for the day were I waited from 7-30 almost six hours in extreme pain before I was taken to theatre for a 40 minutes operation I do believe if I had not complained to who I think was the ward sister I would have waited a lot longer     I understand there are a lot of NHS patience being treated in park hospital now but to after wait that long in extreme pain and paying for private treatment was disgusting.

title: Excellent
body: Had a couple of procedures yesterday and I was so well looked after, both in the treatment I received and the courtesy extended to me, I feel I must bring it to your attention. The doctor and nurse were superb and I cannot praise them high enough. Thank you

title: Best Practice
body: This is the best practice I have experienced. I have lived in London and Hove in East Sussex and have had several GPs over the years. I’m 53. This is by far the best surgery. Accessible, personal, all  staff in GPs are consistently good and attentive.

author: Deaf service user
title: MRI experience
body:
I attended for a head MRI in July. I am a bilateral hearing aid user and obviously needed to remove these for the scan. I felt really anxious about being in the scanner and not being able to hear anyone. I vocalised my concern to the radiographers present. I was given a pump style buzzer to use in an emergency. I was asked to test this to allow me to hear that someone was aware of any concern. I could not hear the buzzer on the test, I advised those present of this, I was told make sure you press it hard and it will be fine.  
I was then given headphones to wear to listen to music to help minimise the noise of the machine. The music was extremely faint to me. Then when the radiographers spoke over the headphones by the time I recognised that there was a voice speaking they had finished talking, therefore unaware of what was being said to me. I felt alone, scared and isolated while in the machine. I feel that there was no recognition of my hearing disability and the heightened anxiety that is experienced when you can't hear the world around you. Adding a restricted space where you are confined within a head cage to this made the whole experience quite traumatic.  
Once the scan was over I informed the radiographer that I could not hear them. I was met with I was talking to you. I could not get out of the room quick enough. I needed to get to an environment where I felt safe and back in control of my surroundings.

author: Heyyou32
title: Unfair treatment in gynaecology
body:
Each time I came here I left feeling horrible & ignored.  
I suffer with extreme heavy periods, I get large blood clots I struggle each month that I am on it. I finally got to see gynaecology. I struggle to talk sometimes so writing it on paper and giving it to the doctor helps me. I walked into the room & said I wrote what I struggle with down while trying to give them my phone. They shook their hand and said no no you read. At that point I got super anxious. Each time I tried to talk youd hear them mhh over me or they would talk over me & saying ohh so sorry to hear that ( I had only got a couple words in & never got the chance to finish). Their attitude had no care to me, I found it was really blunt and forced and felt no compassion, it felt very - shut up hurry up and leave - attitude.They said there’s nothing they can do to help me. Not even suggest any pain relief that could help with managing day to day . They said only way is to give you the coil. I told them I have vaganismis it’s painful to insert things how would you get it in? I asked what if I don’t like it how do you remove it they asked why would you want to do that? I said well what if I don’t like it so they said well why would you want to do that. I was silent so they replied with it’s in there for 6months. All I wanted to know was if I don’t like it being in me how would I get it removed, will it hurt? What’s the risks etc. There was no reassurance at all. They asked me what do I want if I didn’t want them to examine me but I’m sure others don’t want someone examining their private parts when you feel super uncomfortable talking to someone like that.I went to my doctor, turns out they shouldn’t of discharged me and I was meant to get it done in the hospital not the doctors. The gynaecologist appointment only lasted less than two minutes. My doctors appointment lasted longer & they were super reassuring & asked me if I had scans done or blood tests to make sure I didn’t have PCOS etc etc I felt the gynaecologist didn’t care.

author: woodpeckernb63
title: I am not used to mixed wards and was very near to tears
body:
I was recently admitted as an emergency to Ninewells Hospital. I was welcomed into the admission ward where I was shocked to find it was a mixed ward. I came to accept this as they were receiving and discharging all the time and the nurses were respectful of my feelings of discomfort with the mixture. The nursing care and indeed the care from the doctors and consultants were excellent.  
I had to go to theatre for an operation and was moved to ward 8. I was ready to go to theatre in my gown and stockings. When I was moved through I was put into a bay of 5 men and myself. I was so upset, it was meal time and everyone was tucking into their tea. A nurse then came and told me to go to the toilet before theatre, I was mortified and had to come out of my curtains with all there men staring and in my gown tied at the back, and then had to ask where the toilets were. I know in this environment the nurses get used to mixed wards but I am not and was very near to tears.  
My journey to and from theatre were uneventful and I was glad to get my operation over.  
On wakening in the middle of the night after my op and not knowing where I was I was desperate for the toilet, I pressed my buzzer which I found out later was not working, luckily a nurse was passing, she helped me to the toilet but stopped to give me a row for shuffling my feet! I have a bladder condition and thought I was going to wet myself again a very upsetting experience.  
The next time I needed my buzzer was when I woke through the night and my heart was racing like a train, luckily a nurse heard my cries for help, this was deeply distressing for me, I thought I may have been having a heart attack.  
The nurses couldn’t be faulted on this occasion.  
Other occasions the nurses were short and rough with patients and although I am always a champion of NHS, in my opinion some of these employees would be better elsewhere.  
When I reported my buzzer not working the response from a nurse was it’s not been working for 2 months.

title: Colonoscopy and gastroscope Examination
body: I just want to thank the whole team for my excellent treatment yesterday, they had quite a job, and wasn’t without pain, but they were able to complete the procedure and I have nothing but praise for them. I’ve had quite a few things done in the last 2years, all on the NHS and my opinion is we are very, very lucky to have it.

title: Fantastic Practice
body:
I have been a patient at St George's Medical Practice for a number of years now. They never fail to provide excellent, efficient patient care.
Thank you!

title: Red Tape
body: I tried to get an appointment after suffering from chronic digestive problems for 2 weeks. I got so desperate I went to the hospital. I was advised to get a blood test, I booked one and had to wait over a week then turned up this morning and they refused to do it! 🤬

title: Good practice
body:
Phoned for an appointment this morning and got a call back within 15 minutes.
Receptionist was polite and helpful.

title: A good, practical programme to manage…
body: The programme follows a logical and easy to understand introduction to CBT and provides excellent tools and real life examples to help you progress through the modules and your journey.  The aims of the programme are realistic and help you arrive at a more balanced few of your anxieties and worries.  The regular fortnightly  reviews with the therapist are a great way to test your understanding and ask any questions.  I really feel this has helped me to understand more about how I become anxious and worried, how I behave when I'm feeling those emotions and how to better manage those emotions before they can become overwhelming.  I would recommend this programme.

title: Good doctors and nurses
body:
Nightmare appointment system?
You need to be on the phone early and be able to wait alone time to get through?
Even then they only have so many appointments! I ended up going to the walk-in hospital and they sent an urgent message to my doctors for a appointment?

title: Great practice
body: Attended for diabetic review. Seen on time. Nurse was extremely thorough and there was no sense of being rushed. Clear advice and follow up appointment booked then and there.

title: Lovely Nurse
body: I didn't have to wait long and the nurse was very confident in what she had to do.She put me at ease and was very professional.

title: Horrible experience
body:
Appt time was for 8 . Got seen at 10 15 
Not enough numbing and it was pain full . I have a heart condition and anxiety. No one read my notes and they proceeded to put a cover over my face . When I ask if someone could hold my hand they said no . That’s what I call a horrible experience

title: noone wants to help
body: Lucky enough to get through to this practice at 9am this morning, (usually im holding for at least 40 minutes after 10 minutes of trying to get past the engaged tone) the message came on to say there was no routine appointments left at 9am! When I got through I was told I dont meet the criteria for an emergency appointment.  offered a possible antibiotic when noone has seen me and feel today how I always feel after ringing this practice,  stressed!!!!  There has to be a better way - or they just have too many patients to cope with.  Its really not good enough!

title: Great improvements
body:
My recent experiences have been very positive and pleasant. I’ve always found doctors and nurses excellent doing their best but everyone struggling with volume of demand looking worn out and sometimes reception staff obviously frustrated and looking unhappy and fed up. It was so nice to feel front of house staff seemingly happy in their work, very helpful and on top of their task, working as a team. This, despite  queue of patients - some unwell anxious, some with a bit of attitude.  
The feel good feeling seemed to be infectious and the atmosphere in waiting room patient and relaxed. I witnessed one receptionist being extremely helpful and patient with someone struggling to check in    On screen. Came out from behind desk and very patiently explained what to do. Result!  Pleasure to witness. Well done everyone.  Professional and support staff. Doing your best in very difficult circumstances with the huge demand.  Thank you.

author: Julwy83
title: It took me quite a while to find someone to help.
body:
After many years (7+) of trying to get support/help for my mum's mental and emotional health, we eventually got a referral. After a long wait (6mths+), and then a bit of a false start (3mths+), got to see someone who actually listened and engaged with my mum and I about our concerns/issues and need for support and help.  
It was great to finally have a knowledgeable professional who actually listened and tried to help us with our concerns for my mum's mental health. We eventually got a diagnosis and help with guidance around how best to support my mum and significantly improve my mum's mental health and daily life.  
It took me quite a while to find someone to help. Sadly the issues faced throughout the NHS continue to multiply and have quite concerning impacts. Particularly for the vulnerable and/or elderly.  
I was sad to hear that there is talk of further cutbacks and cost savings in this already underfunded and overstretched area. It is a simple fact that without further additional investment (and practical application of such) in this area. More and more preventable problems will arise, leading to further and more serious issues and demands being placed on many other areas of the NHS.

links.id: length of time to get initial appointment

author: deltars76
title: I left the appointment in tears feeling very hopeless
body:
I was diagnosed with a widespread pain disorder by this service last month.  
I left the appointment in tears feeling very hopeless and honestly more doubtful that I have a pain disorder than before I went in to the appointment.  
Most of the discussion focused on my long standing mental health problems. My symptoms were hardly discussed. My symptoms are widespread and so painful and disruptive that I frequently think about suicide as a way of escaping. In desperation I asked if they were sure there is nothing wrong with my leg (it has the most persistent and strongest pain and has never even been x-rayed). They jabbed some locations on it, confirmed they hurt, then just announced its fine.  
I was drawn a diagram, given a leaflet that I have read before, which referred me to websites I have visited before.  
I was given a chance to ask questions at the end but I was upset and couldn't think of any.They said they would refer me for an assessment with the clinical psychologist in the pain service to see if they can offer anything that will help me learn to cope.I have a lot of pain. I don't have joint pain from an injury that didn't heal. I have pain in my left leg, in my hips, my upper back, inside of my lower back, pins and needles in my lower back, a right hand that tingles, a right leg and foot that tingles, and the left hand has started to as well. I have pain inside of my chest that makes it hard to breathe when it gets really bad. I have pain in my mid section. I have rolled around in pain instead of sleeping for the last 3 nights. When I get up I feel stingy and swollen.I have a full time job that it hurts to do, and I can't afford to work lessI have just been told that this pain is permanent, they don't even try to help you reduce the pain, just cope with it. It's like a life sentence.All they can do is send you to psychology. I could get no information about what might be offered to me, but had it in my head that surely, as a person in this much pain who has just been told its permanent, I might at least find out soon and be able to start trying. I am desperate to feel better.I received a letter shortly after the appointment to say I can't be given an appointment due to staffing problems. I reacted badly to this and decided to try and accept the fact that psychology wouldn't be able to help me anyway. I was angry that me and my pain matter so little that I was allowed to be left with no help at all (except my GP who is very understanding, but all they can do is prescribe pills that I am not convinced are working at all)I tried to cancel the appointment, I would rather be discharged without help and at least have the lack of help acknowledged and recorded somewhere, and do my best for myself rather than be left with the promise of help one day in the future.I was persuaded to stay on the list but I still don't know when I'll get an appointment, and if the outcome of that has a chance of being helpful.This is one of the country's leading clinics for the management of all forms of pain and they have offered me nothing.I am in the middle of a particularly bad flare over the last week that has consisted of 3 full nights of rolling around in agony instead of sleeping, and pain lasting throughout the day in several areas. I didn't know you could hurt this much without being beaten up or in a car accident. I am really struggling with how I was diagnosed, the fact that I do have to live like this, and the fact that its ok to send me away with no support or treatment. It feels really inhumane.

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have received the best care & attention
body:
My experience on the Coronary Care Ward has been absolutely brilliant. The staff all have good patience and are exceptionally good. I am very lucky to be here on this ward. I have received the best care and attention on Coronary Care. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff - I would come back full time if I could.  
The ward has been incredibly comfortable and kept very clean. All the food has been excellent - I really cannot grumble about a single thing. I also manage to sleep well at night as it isn't too noisy. A few less needles would be nice but I understand it can't be helped.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Cannot fault staff anywhere you go
body:
I have been in since Tuesday and I have experienced a few wards since then. You really cannot fault the staff anywhere you go. The staff always explain what is happening - for instance what the tablets they give me are and what they do. I really cannot fault the attitude of the staff. They show real patience and never fob you off - if they tell you they will be there in a minute then they will be. I couldn't name anyone in particular as everyone has been excellent.  
The staff are always going around cleaning the ward, changing bedsheets etc. The bathrooms are all absolutely spotless - any mess you just have to mention it to a staff member and it is cleaned up right away. When it comes to the food, the menu itself is nice and there is a good variety of options. However, everything is just a bit overcooked. For instance, the chicken is always very dry. The noise levels at night are fine and all the staff are very considerate when you are trying to sleep. Aside from the food, there are no areas I can think of that need improving..

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff all very good to me
body:
Everything has been fine so far on the Stroke & Rehab Ward. The staff are all very good to me. Any explanations or communication from staff has been good. I can get a bit confused sometimes but the staff make sure to take the time to explain it to me. All the staff are incredibly pleasant. I couldn't name anyone in particular over the other as everyone has been great. I have had several physiotherapists and OTs in with me during my stay and they have also been very good and helpful. Emma in particular has been a great help.  
Stroke & Rehab has been very comfortable and is always kept spotless. The food has been absolutely great - there is plenty of it and always a good choice available. The ward can be a bit noisy at times, but it is understandable with everything that needs to go on. I have no suggestions for improvement - everything has all been fine.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Everyone has been very lovely & helpful
body:
The Children's Ward at Daisy Hill Hospital has been very good. The staff have all been really lovely and incredibly helpful. All communication I have had with staff has been excellent. Joanne who was working yesterday was particularly nice and very good. All the staff have got a very good attitude. Everyone has been incredibly helpful and ensured that we have had no issues.  
Our side room has been kept incredibly spotless and we have both been very comfortable. The room has led everything we have needed. There are no areas I can think of that need improving as everything has been perfectly fine so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I have received very good care from even better nurses
body: I came in on Friday and so far everything has been fine, I have received very good care from even better nurses. The ward is very clean, you can tell it is cleaned multiple times a day. All the facilities are good. Communication has been good, the staff are really informative. My ideal situation would be not to be in here of course, however I cant complain about my stay as the staff are really doing a great job.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: listensq76
title: I left that hospital feeling so totally confused
body:
The doctor at ENT department kept saying I need to see dermatologist as I had skin condition on my lower neck. I was so confused coz I wanted them to look at where the abscess on my upper neck area was still producing tiny amounts of pus and still has foul smelling. That was the real reason why I went to see them. They confused me that I need to see a dermatologist for I mean what for, just for the small abscess I got or my skin condition.  
I left that hospital feeling so totally confused why they kept mentioning dermatologist. I wasn’t too concerned about my skin condition on my lower neck as it’s part of going through peri-menopause and I had allergic reaction from HRT tablet. I told them it was eczema since they were so concerned about it. So they felt my neck and said they can’t feel any lump and still continues to say, see dermatologist. Why can they just go on what I was there for. I don’t feel the need to tell them about my skin condition as it has totally nothing to do with them as they are the ENT consultant not dermatologist.  
I’m hard of hearing myself and visited ENT for yearly review since I was a child as long as I remembered. I do actually know the difference between ENT consultation and dermatologist.

author: DeeDeeBella
title: How can my 13 year old have OCD?
body:
My daughter, was in P7 when Covid hit. She missed all her High School transition events, end of term Leaver’s Party and saying goodbye to the school she’d been at for the last 7 years. Everyone thought the children were handling all this very well.  
They got to Secondary School then a few months in were hit with another Lockdown. More disruption and upheaval. My daughter, who had sailed through primary school without any dramas, was quietly hiding a secret.  
One day she came to me and said she thought she had OCD. I wondered what exactly she wanted me to do about it? Her dad is a tidy freak and I just assumed she was taking after him. I explained we all have a bit of OCD about things. She got cross with me and walked away. On several occasions since this first conversation she came to me but each time was being more concerned and adamant she wanted a doctor appointment to get an OCD diagnosis.  
I was beginning to get frustrated with her. Then I asked her what made her think she needed to see a doctor. Her answer shocked me. She proceeded to tell me all the things she was doing that was affecting her life and thoughts. She was constantly fixing chairs, plumping cushions, moving coasters, ornaments and picture frames into certain positions, lining up table mats so they were centred and not squint. The list goes on. The worst one which was affecting her the most was the routine/ritual she had developed when doing the dishes. It took her 2 hours and if anything broke the routine she would start all over again! She had been masking all these rituals and I was really disappointed in myself for not noticing. I felt so guilty. These rituals were preventing her from going out and being with friends. She couldn’t leave the house until she had completed her rituals. She was always late to get places and often decided to cancel get-togethers.  
We contacted our GP who suggested speaking to Guidance. Together they decided a CAMHS referral would be beneficial for her.  
When we had our first appointment I was impressed at how openly and maturely my daughter explained her situation, thoughts and feelings. Jill the nurse made us feel so relaxed and comfortable which really helped.  
She selected Lisa Ingram to work with my daughter as she was very experienced in Cognitive Behavioural Therapy and Jill felt they would get on well.  
When we met Lisa we were instantly put at ease. She and my daughter clicked straight away. I felt pleased that my daughter was able to speak openly to Lisa. Lisa knew all the right things to say. She wrote very detailed notes about everything was saying to her. She really wanted to know all the details and get to know my daughter so she could give her the best help and advice possible.  
We started with weekly appointments which then moved to fortnightly. I went along to the first few meetings then my daughter was happy to see Lisa on her own.  
Lisa spoke to to guidance teacher as well and offered her some advice which would help my daughter through her anxieties over exams and tests at school. She did a couple of home visits as well to see how she behaved in her own environment and could witness some of the rituals.  
She came up with a plan and strategies to help with her compulsive thoughts, gave us books to read and recommended other books/journals to buy which would help.  
My daughter was very driven to help herself to get well and Lisa was the person who helped her get there. We can’t thank her enough!  
My daughter had 9 months of appointments with Lisa and I am astonished at what they achieved in such a relatively short space of time. We were sad when it was time to stop the appointments and lots of my daughter's rituals had begun to creep in again. I think she was a bit anxious about having to give up Lisa’s support. However, she knew she was ready to. She had lots of information and strategies she could refer back to.  
It has been almost 3 months since her last appointment and she is doing great. She still has moments where she is fixing the furniture and re-doing the dishes but it is not affecting her life the way it did before. She is seeing her friends lots more than before and she is so happy now.  
Overall, we are delighted with the service we received from the CAMHS team. They have been a godsend and turned out lives around.  
Thank you Lisa.

author: 26JM
title: My Counselling Journey
body:
Following some serious health issues last December, I became angry, disappointed with life, my health, and my body. For years I had invested my time to maintain a healthy & positive lifestyle through a healthy diet, yoga, meditation, going to the gym, and doing things I enjoyed.  
This impact on my physical and mental health was the reason I developed anxiety, low mood, loss of confidence and no motivation. I was signed off work long term. This brought to the surface many past emotional stresses and pain. I felt stuck, lost in my own bubble, and I didn’t know how to move forward.  
After my initial phone call following my referral to Inclusion Thurrock, I was referred for cognitive behaviour therapy. After my first session, it was decided this wasn’t the correct therapy for me at that time and I was referred for counselling therapy.  
My counselling journey started in February with James.  
It took me a lot of courage to reach out for help, feeling very unsure if this is what I needed. Looking back, I am so grateful to those who encouraged me to seek help.  
My therapy with James was face to face, he was kind, patient, professional and respectful, giving me the personal safe space, I needed to speak openly about my emotions, thoughts, fears, and grief. I was amazed how easily I was able to speak openly about these emotions to someone I didn’t know.  
James listened patiently, respected me throughout the whole process, understood and encouraged me to work with my emotions from within and giving me tools to help me explore to find a method I could work with.  
After six months of counselling, I am grateful for every session which allowed me to offload fifty years of past trapped emotions and fears, including recent events. I feel I am now in place of peace, acceptance, and trust from within. There is still a journey ahead for my healing; my health, working with my emotions, not letting people use me or take me for granted and my aim now is to get back into the things I love to do and not to be afraid to try new things too.  
I have confidence and strength to know I can do this and respect that ups and downs are part of the journey.  
A big heartfelt thank you James for all his support in my journey to find my inner peace and confidence.  
[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']

author: Twentytwo
title: Excellent, compassionate, GP care
body:
My husband had been experiencing a number of health complaints over a 6 month period, seeing different doctors at our local GP service and generally not feeling well in himself. Following an appointment with Dr Whittingham, who had taken the time to carefully review his notes, he was able to diagnose depression which had previously been missed.  
His experience and knowledge was very evident, he was thoughtful, understanding and sensitive in exploring everything with my husband, allowing him to be honest about his symptoms and experience. Dr Whittingham even took the time to invite me in for a joint appointment to explore my thoughts and views on support and treatment options, which made me feel very included.  
My husband didn’t want to use antidepressant medication and never felt fourced to, due to the care and experience of Dr Whittingham, he was supported to try alternatives and was supported to take the time he needed to begin recovery.  
He was reviewed regularly, felt listened to and generally had a very positive experience of GP care through a very difficult time for our family.  
We are very grateful for the care he received, thank you.

author: User123.4
title: My care in ty llidiard
body:
Overall I had a good experience with the care I received during my stay in ty llidiard. I was offered a range of therapies, education, and most of the staff were supportive and encouraging. The staff would provide meal support when needed and would always be willing to have an engagement session if you needed. Each individual had the opportunity to attend their ward round weekly in order to ask/request anything they would like.  
90% of the staff were supportive and helpful although a few were rude and made me feel like a burden on them. They would talk about you right in front of you, discuss you with other patients, didn’t respect that you were struggling during meal times and overall made you feel as if you were worthless. This didn’t apply to most of the staff as most of them were helpful, encouraging and would always respect you.  
In the future in order to make the ward a more homely environment more activity’s would be helpful on the ward outside of school hours and young people should be allowed home comforts with them.  
Overall my stay in ty llidiard help me I’m recovery.

author: Adrian67
title: Surgery at Northwick Park Hospital.
body:
I'm 56 years old, male and earlier this week had surgery for the first time in my life. The surgery took place at Northwick Park hospital in North west London. I had a benign cyst the size of an orange removed from my neck. It had attached itself to the left side of my thyroid gland in my throat.  
I spent two and a half days in hospital all in all, going in on a Tuesday morning and leaving at around Thursday. I'd like to say from the outset, that during that time at Northwick Park, it was faultless in every way. I couldn't have asked for a better outcome during the whole experience.  
From the moment I arrived to the moment I left, every member of staff I encountered was an absolute credit to the NHS. The anaesthetist was superb, putting me at ease from the very start, and the surgeon (Miss Lui) who, with her team, spent I believe three hours in theatre......I will be forever in their debt.  
The aftercare was exemplary, and the care shown by them all on the tenth floor was humbling. I thank them all. I will forever champion Northwick Park hospital for all they did for me.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Ess.elle.bee
title: A&E Inverclyde Royal Hospital
body:
My 8 year old daughter recently attended A&E at IRH with ongoing chest pain, which we have been concerned about for some time now, however on this day it became increasingly worse.  
We were welcomed at the main reception by one of the clerkess', who was really nice to us, checked my daughter in quickly and efficiently.  
The department wasn't too busy, so we weren't waiting for too long to be seen.  
We were called in by one of the staff nurses called Avril, she spoke to my daughter directly then spoke with myself. I really liked this, as it made my daughter feel that she was being listened to, rather than let Mum do all the talking as usual. Avril carried out an ECG and took all my daughter's vital signs. She explained at each step exactly what she was doing and why this had to be done. She also gained my daughter's consent before carrying out any of these tasks. My daughter felt so at ease and was reassured the whole time.  
We then met with one of the Doctors ( we didn't catch her name) who again explained everything to my daughter, had a listen to her heart and had a quick chat about what could be the problem. My daughter was very anxious about the situation and she has been feeling like us adults aren't listening to her. So it was very reassuring that these lovely health professionals did listen to her.  
Thank you again to the staff we encountered during this time. My daughter is feeling so much better

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Definitely well looked after in here
body:
I came over recently, I have had a good stay and I am definitely well looked after in here.  
The nurses are brilliant, morning and night they are first class.  
The communication is great, They go into every detail.  
I haven't actually used any of the facilities yet, although there is not TV in our bay and it would be good to have a radio. It would also be good if they had chargers, I forgot mine at home and no one has got one on the ward.  
My room is vey clean, its cleaned everyday.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Thanks to the staff for their commitment and dedication
body:
It has been an extremely difficult time after discovering a life-threatening diagnosis of a family member. One million thoughts go through your head of the road ahead, the possible outcomes and it is all very daunting.  
However, I am at a loss as to what to say about the amazing staff in haematology. The support they have provided for my mother so far has been phenomenal, and extremely reassuring to witness. They have taken the time to explain everything to us, the family, and we know they are doing everything in their power to help out mother.  
The staff are so empathetic and compassionate, exactly what a person who is dealing with such sick patients should express. There is a long road ahead, but we want to thank all in haematology for their commitment and dedication thus far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Under pressure staff, understaffed ward
body: I arrived yesterday from Daisy hill. The care in Craigavon has been great, The  nurses are excellent, the nurse Sharon that was in yesterday was lovely and Lewis couldn't do enough for me. I have been updated regarding everything. The TV had no remote but one of the girls came in and helped me get the tv working okay, which was brilliant. I cant fault anything, although at night it can be a bit noisy especially with the bins and I would say that the ward is very understaffed as especially last night they where very under pressure.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: good communication
body: The staff have been absolutely great, I have been in a couple of days now and the care has been brilliant. The communication is really good, staff are good at giving information without causing confusion, as sometimes I think it can be a lot to process. Facilities are great, my room is lovely and spacious. Cleaners are great, everything is spotless.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: travellerrf46
title: Fantastic care given.
body:
All of the staff in the stroke ward were very attentive to my 98 year old late gran. My gran had advanced dementia and sadly had a stroke during her stay in hospital. She was promptly moved to ward 31. All of the nurses, healthcare support workers, domestics and doctors were amazing. The SCN was very involved in the family situation and ensured all family members were involved in my grans care. My gran had never been so settled as she was in the ward. At the end of her life she was treated with dignity and given a single room as soon as it became available.  
Fantastic care given.  
Thank you, from our family.

author: RobertaSF
title: Operation  in Hospital orthopaedic’s dept.
body:
Had hip replacement op at the end of July (Queen Elizabeth Hosp).  
My consultant Mr Jenkinson , his anaesthetist, and his amazing theatre team were all there for me We are all very good at complaining when we are not happy,I am on to do the opposite.  
From coming into admissions feeling very apprehensive,I was taken care of right the way through to my final destination, the theatre. The staff, who were many in theatre, were all there to help me cope with my spinal surgery.I felt very anxious, when you can’t feel your lower body, but they made me comfortable, and spoke to me and helped me all through the procedure.  
The Recovery room, was made much better by the lovely staff who talked me through what they were doing.  
Reached my room and everyone from nursing staff, physio’s, occupational therapist’s, all helped me through what I had to do next.  
Thank you, one and all, for making my experience the best it could be in the circumstances.

author: Molly6565
title: Saxon Suite
body: I attend Saxon Suite every 6 weeks, but also at other times too.  The nursing care is always excellent.  The nurses  are all lovely and put everyone at ease.  They make the time that I have to attend for treatments a more pleasant one.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I don't have a bad word to say about anyone
body:
The care on the trauma ward has been top notch. The treatment from the staff is brilliant, everyone is really pleasant and always has a wee chat with you. I really haven't got a bad word to say about anyone.  
The cleanliness is marvelous, I've never seen a place so clean. Communication with staff is always a great standard and facilities on the ward are accessible and satisfactory.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: muscabt64
title: Excellent service
body: The service in Craigavon is excellent

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Five star treatment
body:
Last week I had my third cycle of chemotherapy at the day unit at the Victoria Hospital Kirkaldy. As with the two previous cycles, the care, attention and expertise of the nursing staff was impeccable. Chemotherapy is not a pleasant experience, but the attention, patience and understanding of the staff reduced the physical and mental stress to a minimum. To my mind, unhesitatingly five-star service. Thank you, staff, and please take note managers.

William C Mackrodt

title: Great Practice - Just What the NHS Should Be
body: The new on-line booking service was a very good experience (once I'd worked out how to do it!).  I was contacted on the same day by friendly and helpful Practice Staff to make 2 necessary appointments in good time.  Well done.  And the clinical staff have always been keen to assist, and they believe in the NHS.

title: Great reception staff
body:
It was an absolutely smooth process of being booked and seen on the same day 

The reception team was extremely friendly and helpful and dealt with my query with urgency 
5 stars to the team

title: Dissapointing
body: I put in a request for my husbands regular medication, and yet again they missed off 2 items , this has happened several times to my and my husbands regular medication . I cannot understand why and how it happens. When we contact the surgery to let them know medication have been missed off, we still have to wait the normal waiting time before the prescription gets to the chemist despite the fact that it is the surgeries error .

title: Great  Practise
body:
I joined Medlock Medical Practise and I'm so very glad I did.
The Care, Compassion, Kindness & Understanding from the Staff & Medical Team is Outstanding in my opinion.
Also I noticed that when the Senior Partner was leaving the Practise yesterday evening, he took time to converse with the all the patients in the waiting room. Respect....

title: Oh dear, avoid if you can.
body: It is very difficult to get an appointment, but you may get a call back when you fill in the new on line form. The form is not at all user friendly, and needs revising, many of the questions are of no relevance. My partner does not use technology, it took him 3 months to receive a call back about his health - he is now scared of contacting the surgery - as when he actually saw a GP his health had got worse, and he had more problems to discuss. The doctor told him that he only had 5 mins to consult with him, and cut him short! The surgery does not appear to offer 5 yearly health checks for patients over 40 years of age - never been offered them in decades. You need to keep on top of what injections/tests are needed yourself - as there does not appear to be a system to call you in. The surgery in St Columb always looks grubby and uncared for. Tried to change to other surgeries - without success, it really is a postcode lottery, sad as it used to be really good.

title: Poor practice
body:
For an entire working week I have tried to ask for help with pain medication.I have personally called and also made requests using Ask My GP. This is after the surgery received a letter from my consultant asking that I have a review and pain medication for nerve pain and suggested fibromyalgia. I have explained this impacts my daily life greatly and day to day movement brings pain as described in the letter from the consultant. I have been deferred,promised a call from the GP and given an appointment which will be a month from the surgery receiving the consultants letter.
I cannot get any relief from the pain from over the counter medication.I cannot understand why I would wait a month to then hopefully start getting relief for my condition.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I have been with this practice for over 8 years now. I have always received excellent care from the Doctors and Practice Nurses. Oakvale compares well with some less than satisfactory surgeries in Liverpool I have experienced.

Yes it can be difficult to get through but sadly this is the experience everywhere nowadays.

title: There when you need them!
body:
I have been with this practice for over forty years  and without reservation I can say that the Dr, Nurses and reception staff are highly competent, well trained, kind and helpful. Importantly there is a consistency of staff. Recently I have had a health scare and all the staff have responded very swiftly, assisting me with the most appropriate solutions, allaying my fears, and giving me confidence that I’m being well looked after.  
Friends tell me of experiences where they are basically ignored by their practices- you won’t get that here!  I would not hesitate to recommend this practice.

title: Receptionist made a difference
body: I called into the practice to get a form for blood tests, the receptionist made such a difference to the experience I have had before.  She seemed genuinely ready to help, her tone and approach demonstrated great customer service.  While waiting for the form I heard her speak to other patients with an engaging, friendly demeanour that one has come not to expect from drs receptionists.  I don't visit the practice regularly but I hope DMC are able to keep her as on the basis of my visit she is an asset to the practice.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been so good to me.
body:
I have had a good stay, I really cant thank the staff enough. Everyone has been brilliant and have taken great care of me.  
The communication with staff has been really good, I am given regular updates and information all the time. Facilities are grand. I wouldn't change anything about my stay, the staff have been so good to me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The care has been brilliant, the staff have been amazing.
body:
The care has been brilliant, the staff have been amazing.  
The nurses are always right there if you need them. The food I would say could be better, but that's my only fault.  
I think the ward is lovely and all the staff are really chatty and friendly. The cleanliness is fabulous, my room is cleaned every singe day without fail.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am really happy with the care I have been receiving
body:
I am really happy with the care I have been receiving, the staff are always really attentive with me and caring. The communication is all okay, everything communicated to me has been okay and I've never had any problems. The facilities on the ward are good.  
The food is lovely, I didn't have high hopes but I am actually surprised how nice it has been.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Brilliant doctor and great service
body:
The doctor I saw last night 31/7/23 was brilliant, he kept the children in the waiting room entertained each time he came to shout a patient through and was a genuinely lovely person with his funny demeanour. 

He was very thorough and went through all my medical history too which a lot of doctors do not.  

This person made the 5 hour wait much more bearable and he really does deserve commendation for his great service at a time when other people were losing their patience.  

We are lucky to have this service locally.

title: Excellent, friendly service
body: Easy to book an appointment online, I was offered a slot next working day. Minimal wait time before being called in, the GP was very friendly and made me feel at ease, she answered all my queries and reviewed my medications to ensure all was up to date. All round good service.

title: Outstanding GP practice
body: I have been with this surgery for 25 years and can say for its entirety it’s been second to none. That’s from the GPS, Nurses and Administration and support staff. Through COVID while the service was limited it was balanced and proportionate and you could still speak to and if necessary see the GP. They have kept the best practices of this by still providing telephone screening, follows up with an immediate appointment if it’s required. This feels an effective use of their time and mine as on occasions a telephone conversation is enough. In a time where there are so many moans and groans about GPS I wanted to write as I have just booked an appointment with the receptions staff. The conversation wasn’t just practical it was pleasant, light hearted and effective. Thank you all for all you do and continue to do! Elaine

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am very pleased the the service.
body:
The care in Craigavon has been exceptional, I am very pleased the the service. I have been treated with nothing but respect and all the staff are so pleasant. I would love to get home, but I know I am in great hands.  
The facilities on the ward are great, everything is accessible and easy to use. I wouldn't change anything at all, the ward staff are great and nothing has been a bother.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Joke
body: Position 2 for 40 minutes? Seriously? That's a complete joke. I'm a receptionist at a surgery myself. That is embarrassing. Employ more staff please and sort it out. What on earth.

title: Can’t even get through to receptionist
body: Waiting for an hour to get through to receptionist for an appointment. When you do get through you are then given another appointment on the phone and then seen in person it’s such a hurdle just trying to see a GP, it makes you feel more unwell with the stress of just trying to get an appointment.

title: Awful experience
body: This practice is so disfunctional impossible to get appointments short-staffed. I have to deal with this surgery as it's where my elderly parents are registered and dread anything to do with it unless I have hours to spare .can't get through on the phone . Prescription service is awful such a long wait or missing needs closing down and re shuffling or new management

author: chassisfn87
title: Brilliant experience
body: Please pass on my thanks to the staff at Audiology at the New Vic - my grandma (almost 90!) hasn't been out really since Pandemic - her hearing is now pretty awful and she wasn't wearing her hearing aids. She was given a cancellation and seen very quickly. Gary was so patient and helpful - instructing her on how to wear them and making sure they fit right. She went into the experience so stressed and came out delighted. Thank you so much on her behalf and mine.

author: Daujr86
title: Care of my mum
body: I can only say that my mother received excellent care when seen at craigavon area hospital last week . From entering to leaving the hospital with a special thank you to the receptionist ,office staff, Mr Mc Cormack, Ruth and  Maria midwives . They went to get length to look after and show great care of both of us .

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A&e
body:
I had a fall, with injuries to my face knees and chest. 
The nursing team was good getting the relevant tests done and giving temporary dressing whilst waiting for the doctor. There was only one doctor on duty for that night and I did not see one until the day staff came in at 8am. 
We were there from 1:30am and we were there for almost 8 hours.
My blood pressure was extremely high and I did not get any treatment for that until I was referred to another department around 10:00am
You need to put the right levels of night staffing in A&e. Very disappointing.

author: Care Opinion
title: Very understanding physio
body: Attended Stobhill physio for knee complaint. Given graded series of exercises and reviewed regularly. Gradual improvement with realistic goals and written material. David was my physio and very understanding.

title: Satisfactory practice
body: My experience with this practice has been good. Most of the time I manage to get an appointment  & do not have to wait too long. Regarding my recent appointment,  I had to wait 1 week, I would have preferred to have been seen earlier as it was a cardio assessment & therefore I was anxious during that weeks wait. The doctor I saw was very good, taking her time & very thorough

title: Travel Vaccinations
body:
We required 3 travel vaccinations for forthcoming holidays. Whilst many might argue if you can afford to go on holiday you can afford to pay for travel vaccinations and to a large degree I agree.  
However the nhs website clearly states that the 3 needed are free on the nhs as the uk doesn't want these diseases bringing to the country. 
Ling House refused to give us these despite the nhs said gp surgeries were "required " to offer these free. 
The nhs further state "yes, all gp surgeries must offer a travel service". 
Why then have you refused?
We today visited a chemist and paid for the vaccinations.  Before the chemist gave us them the chemist said "you do know that these are free from your gp" but we told them you had refused. 
Why do you refuse when nhs says you are required to do so.
 Is your refusal illegal?
I look forward to your reply

title: Hell bent on making life as difficult as possible…
body: Booked an appointment for son. Nurse interfered and cancelled appointment and told me to phone the practice. On hold for a ridiculous amount of time, so went into the practice still on hold. Been told to go on am emergency list and wait for a phone call - this is impossible in my line of work. Now need to go to A&E unnecessarily. Unacceptable.

title: Exceptional service
body:
My doctor referred me for a scan to be done by Yorkshire Health Solutions. 
From the initial text message and a phone call within an hour to book the appointment (given a choice of dates), to ringing up to check about parking at the centre (I live 20 min car drive away), to checking in at reception, to having the scans...  everyone was so very helpful and professional.  
Whilst waiting for my appointment time (i was early), i glanced round an immaculate waiting area, no queuing at reception, everyone greeted on entry.  A steady flow of patients coming in and out.  Patients greeted by their practitioner.  A patient having popped to the loo, told the receptionist there was no loo paper, within 5 mins someone appeared with some to replenish 
Very well run and managed centre with helpful and professional staff.

author: Hanr
title: I would strongly recommend
body: I have just come on here to say that anyone considering using the family nurse partnership I would strongly recommend. As a first time mum having someone be there with you from pregnancy to birth and there after is really lovely as they are with you every step of the way. As it is the same person they can get to know your personal circumstances and cater the advice and services for you based on your family’s needs. I couldn’t recommend more :) I have a great relationship with my Family Nurse Eilish and I don’t know what I’d do without her to ask all my little questions.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very good practice
body: On Monday I had 2 appointments the first one I was kept waiting 20 mins the second appointment I was kept waiting 15 mins. When you attend appointments on time you should be seen on time. If I had attended 20 mins late would I have still been seen?

title: Great
body: Efficient service with Ally. Nothing good communication. Found the overall experience to be very good.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have all been absolutely lovely
body:
I have been in 1 North for a couple of days in one of the side rooms which has been great.  
The foods been absolutely fantastic so far and I couldn't complain with the way that 1 North has been treating me since I was admitted.  
The staff have all been absolutely lovely I couldn't really say anything bad about my experience of them.  
I have been able to understand my treatment very easily thanks to the way they explain things

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Shoddy
body: They hound you to make appointment with multiple media formats. Phone call, text, email and post. The 1st call i got, i advised i was working away and would make appointment when i was home. They continued to chase me to make the appointment. I have now had my appointment, booked via their system, yet they continue to chase me to make an appointment. 3 letters sent after my appointment. One of which was instructions for the appointment, would have been more useful to have receieved prior to appointment.

author: Suecx23
title: Pain management service
body: I’ve been seeing the service for a few years now and I honestly don’t know if I’d still be here without them. I know that sounds dramatic but it’s the absolute truth. Consultant Tim and all the team at Montagu are amazing and so kind and helpful. I’d like to give a special shout out to the wonderful health care support workers, they look after you so well, so empathetic and caring. Thank you especially to Lesley hcsw who always makes me feel safe and cared for, even making me cups of tea, this service is absolutely essential, long may it continue.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Total Shambles. Not fit for purpose
body: Westside Medical Centre feels like a temporary fix. The place is littered with handwritten signs. My appointment wasn't on the system and reception was like the Marie Celeste. I wandered numerous corridors in an attempt to find help. When I did finally find the podiatrist, my appointment was extremely brief. It felt as though I was more of an annoyance than a patient. A whollly unsatisfactory experience

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are all very good with kids
body:
It has been absolutely perfect on the Daisy Children's Ward for myself and my daughter. The staff have all been very lovely and they make sure to explain things to you well. I have to say that the staff are all very good with kids. They also make sure to take the time with you which is good. Everyone I have met has been exceptionally nice. They make routine things such as temperature checks fun for my daughter. I would like to particularly mention Joanne yesterday who has been absolutely lovely.  
Our side room has been absolutely lovely and it has been very clean and comfortable. There is nothing I can think of that needs improving - everything has been absolutely perfect for us.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A lost practice
body: The whole system is bad. Tried ringing, put into a queue (always 6th in line)and get cut off when down to second, so I make a special trip to speak to the receptionist. I'm told I have to use the website. I find the website, log in and request to see someone. Nobody could be bothered to give a response. Tried to get back on the site to ask again and can't get back in. I've had a problem which got worse, taken into hospital for a week been out for about 3 weeks, still not seen a GP and have had zero interest from the centre.

title: What a shambles
body: So, Pond Tail continue to disappoint despite the recent take over and promise of a new era! I have been a patient for around 12 years now. I am fortunate to have really good medical insurance and have not had to trouble the GPs or NHS for some time. The surgery, despite being copied on all of my extensive, private treatment  continue to try and change my prescription randomly, then tell me they are going to call me and don't. Most recently they send me a text message at 16:30 in the afternoon telling me I will get a call first thing but of course you cannot reply to the text message to say I can't make it. You cannot leave a message on the website out of hours so you a message first thing saying i can't make the call and the website says it make take three days to respond! They called me anyway from a withheld number, which for data protection reasons my phone does not accept, then send another text saying they would try later to which you cannot respond either! All this time squandering the tax payers money. Why send a message that cannot be replied to? Why use a withheld number? why not get with the times? Improvement? hard to see where exactly.

title: Disgusting treatment!
body:
Tried to register as a new patient today, was “greeted” by an extremely rude receptionist who said “you can’t we’re full”…….what do you mean “Full”, I’m a human being that pays my NI contributions and taxes and you’re telling me I can’t register…….
So I was given a piece of paper for another surgery to “try”……..
Seriously, my father has just passed away I need help now, and all I get is a piece of paper. You should be ashamed of yourselves and I will be taking this mater further!

You are a complete and utter waste of time!

title: Quick response
body: Submitted online request and received phone call in less than an hour and an appointment the same day. Well done.

title: Great practice
body:
From the day when I joined this surgery until present, I have always experienced and pleasant and excellent experience. In my last visit I went to the doctor with a particular problem and he not only advised and treated that problem but at the same time addressed another problem I was having.
The reception staff are friendly and helpful and are discreet in discussing any issues.
The nurses within the practice are excellent and provide a great service.

title: Good practice
body: Pleasant waiting area. Phoning is not usually a problem. Very experienced nurse for a routine screening and not too long a wait for the appointment. Apology for the wait even though it wasn't that long.
